hackathon-description-text: For 24 hours, we'll build projects together that make Houston a better place to live.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: VP/Software Development Manager at Two Sigma Investments
Assistant Director, IT, City of Houston
President, League of Women Voters of the Houston Area

hackathon-eligibility: Everyone can participate. Projects must be submitted by 12:30p on May 15, 2016 in order to be considered.
hackathon-requirements:
Please include visual aids that help the judges understand your work. This can include:
Anything you present must be accessible through the internet.
hackathon-rules:
You are responsible for working out legal issues with your teammates prior to beginning work. We are not responsible for any intellectual property disputes that arise out of your participation in the hackathon. We encourage everyone to make their work open source. 
We we want everyone to feel welcome, safe, and free to work on civic projects with teams or on their own at the hackathon and all Sketch City events. Please read and abide by the 
 while you’re there. If you feel uncomfortable at any time during the hackathon, please come find one of the organizers so we can help. Or email us and we’ll get right back to you: we’re sarah@sketchcity.org and jeff@sketchcity.org.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Follow up meeting with the Mayor to discuss your project (3 available)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=410 Pierce St, Houston, TX 77002, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is this solving a need, answering a question, serving citizens, or otherwise making an impact?
How big is the challenge that the project addresses?
How far did the team get? Working demos are better than static images.
Did the team present their work in a compelling way? Was it easy to understand the project, the scope, and how far they got?
